intro: Collomia stenosiphon, commonly known as the narrow-lipped camas, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in its range.
